revised_title: Improvements on Photographic Processes and Parathermic Rays of the Solar Spectrum
tldr: The author, J.F.W. Herschel, describes improvements on photographic processes, specifically the chrysotype and cyanotype processes. He also discusses the use of mercury in photography and its ability to create negative models for reproducing positive copies. Additionally, he explores the role of water and nitrate of mercury in enhancing photographic impressions.
